initialRows.detail: Available and patient with non-technical peers/stakeholders
Available and patient with technical peers/stakeholders
Makes changes based on feedback
Handles roadblocks with care and sensitivity
Values the expertise of others (Listen and modify behavior)
Communicates in the correct manner and setting (Does it need to be said? Does it need to be said by me? Does it need to be said right now?)
Express disagreement within a healthy conflict framework
Can be comfortable speaking in front of 'large groups'
Handles various personalities with care and sensitivity
Can communicate trade-off decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Renegotiate Commitment (Not necessarily always speaking in the language of business)
Can speak in the language of other disciplines
Empathize with opposing viewpoints
Demonstrates the ability to mine for conflict
Pulls ideas out of others
Understands where the business is going and is bringing innovation to the conversation before the business is asking for it
Heart of a teacher (Can lead someone to a decision without telling them the decision)
Can challenge principles at all levels within personal discipline
Elevation of problem, co-authoring of the solution for issues
Customer focused mindset
Considering technical impact [Feasibility]
Considering customer value [Fidelity, Value]
Considering business value [Viability]
Have strong opinions, loosely held
Demonstrates emotional courage
Actively develops personal brand
Missional
Demonstrates the ability to disagree and commit
Takes personal responsibility
Engages Socially within the Team
Connects with those seeking help within a reasonable timeframe
Can market an idea within your squad
Can market an idea across multiple squads
Actively building trust with team
Actively building trust with other disciplines
Actively building trust with business leadership
Can work in concurrency
Wins and loses as a team
Baseline skill in coding (Engineer can effectively build, run and debug locally in a language)
Foundational (Working) competence in a language
Comfortable and fluent working in the entire technology stack
Confident in making changes in an existing codebase/feature or other's code
Confident to begin a green field codebase/feature (Knows how to start from new)
Deep understanding of primary language (Performance Concerns, Best Practices, Which to Choose and Why)
Defensive coding (Avoid problematic issues before they arise. Practice of eliminating assumptions in code.)
Self-improvement of craft based on patterns learned through mentorship, feedback or bugs
Zoom out to focus on high impact, multiplier code and design
Evaluates upstream and downstream impact that unlocks company-wide business value
Able to communicate and articulate technical information to all levels of the discipline and company
Ability to move between multiple squads to solve complex problems and influence growth of the team
Can easily switch context while remaining focused on outcomes
